title: Beyond the rice grain.. How rice farmers are repositioning to sustainably grow rice.

tasks.task: Farming and husbandry practices related to rice cultivation in Kenya
subtasks: Planting rice around August
Harvesting rice in late November and December
Practicing ratoon cropping (allowing sprouted rice to grow and harvest again)
Managing farm idleness between cropping seasons
Adapting to changing environmental awareness and climate impact
Implementing water and nutrient use efficiency practices
Introducing regenerative agriculture and sustainable farming methods
Rotational cropping with leguminous crops (e.g., green grams for nitrogen fixation)
Managing crop by-products (straws and husks) through vermicomposting
Utilizing rice husks for biochar production and organic fertilizers
Deep placement of fertilizers (e.g., pelleted urea) to enhance efficiency
Collaborating on cross-learning initiatives for improved rice farming practices
